meanings.definition: To leave suddenly or in a hurry.
meanings.sent1: She bunked out of the party when it got too loud.
meanings.sent2: He bunked from the meeting as soon as it ended.
meanings.sent3: The cat bunked out of the room when the vacuum cleaner started.
meanings.sent4: The idea of exercise made him bunk out of the gym.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected noise made her bunk out of the room in a flash.

meanings.definition: To avoid a responsibility or duty.
meanings.sent1: He bunked his chores to play video games.
meanings.sent2: She bunked her homework by pretending to be sick.
meanings.sent3: The dog bunked guarding the house to chase a squirrel.
meanings.sent4: The student bunked studying for the test by watching TV.
meanings.sent5: They bunked their work responsibilities to go to the beach.

meanings.definition: To sleep in a bunk or makeshift bed.
meanings.sent1: The campers bunked in the cabin during the trip.
meanings.sent2: They bunked on the boat during the fishing expedition.
meanings.sent3: The siblings bunked together in the small room.
meanings.sent4: The soldiers bunked in the barracks during training.
meanings.sent5: The travelers bunked in the hostel for the night.
